content: This opening verse establishes Jesus' lineage from both David and Abraham, showing His royal and covenantal heritage.
Notice the change in language here - Joseph is called the 'husband of Mary' rather than 'father of Jesus', indicating the virgin birth.
The three sets of 14 generations show God's perfect timing and organization in salvation history.
The name Jesus means 'Yahweh saves' - this verse explains the purpose of His coming.
Emmanuel means 'God with us' - this is the great promise of the incarnation.
The wise men recognized Jesus as King of the Jews, showing His royal status even as a child.
The gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh represent kingship, deity, and death respectively.
This fulfills Hosea 11:1, showing how God's plan was being worked out through history.
